Description: A group of title companies agreed to pay a total of $50 million to settle allegations that they engaged in deceptive advertising and unfair business practices in their escrow services.
Stewart Title agreed to pay a $590,000 penalty and $160,000 in costs in settlement of allegations it engaged in unlawful rebate activities.

Company: Stewart Title Guaranty Co. and Electronic Closing Services, Inc. dba E-Title
Description: Stewart Title and E-Title agreed to pay $1,478,576 in penalties and $21,424 in costs in settlement of allegations they issued title policies based on material prepared by Richmond Title Services, which was not licenced to carry out insurance transactions in the state.

Stewart Title agreed to pay a $1,000,400 penalty in settlement of allegations its captive reinsurance agreements constituted unfair competition, deceptive practices, and unlawful rebates, along with allegations of filing false statements.

Info Source: TDI ANNOUNCES MARCH ENFORCEMENT ACTIONS, States News Service, May 7, 2009 (via Nexis).
TDI December Enforcement Actions Result in Nearly $575K in Fines, Restitution, Insurance Journal, February 2, 2011 (via Nexis).

Description: $10,050 fine levied for selling title policies in Columbia County where it did not own, lease, or maintain a title plant, and did not use a duly authorized and appointed title insurance agency who did maintain a title plant in that county
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner
Wisconsin Office of the Commissioner of Insurance

Description: Stewart Title agreed to pay $123,105 in settlement of findings in a Market Conduct Examination of several state insurance law violations.
